Hymn.Arabic: «مُبَارَكٌ الرَّبُّ إِلهُ إِسْرَائِيلَ لأَنَّهُ افْتَقَدَ وَصَنَعَ فِدَاءً لِشَعْبِهِ،,
Hymn.English: 68 "Blessed [is] the Lord God of Israel, For He has visited and redeemed His people,

Hymn.Arabic: 69 وَأَقَامَ لَنَا قَرْنَ خَلاَصٍ فِي بَيْتِ دَاوُدَ فَتَاهُ.
Hymn.English: 69 And has raised up a horn of salvation for us In the house of His servant David

Hymn.Arabic: 70 كَمَا تَكَلَّمَ بِفَمِ أَنْبِيَائِهِ الْقِدِّيسِينَ الَّذِينَ هُمْ مُنْذُ الدَّهْرِ،
Hymn.English: 70 As He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets, Who [have been] since the world began

Hymn.Arabic: 71 خَلاَصٍ مِنْ أَعْدَائِنَا وَمِنْ أَيْدِي جَمِيعِ مُبْغِضِينَا.
Hymn.English: 71 That we should be saved from our enemies And from the hand of all who hate us

Hymn.Arabic: 72 لِيَصْنَعَ رَحْمَةً مَعَ آبَائِنَا وَيَذْكُرَ عَهْدَهُ الْمُقَدَّسَ،
Hymn.English: 72 To perform the mercy [promised] to our fathers And to remember His holy covenant
73 The oath which He swore to our father Abraham:

Hymn.Arabic: 74 أَنْ يُعْطِيَنَا إِنَّنَا بِلاَ خَوْفٍ، مُنْقَذِينَ مِنْ أَيْدِي أَعْدَائِنَا، نَعْبُدُهُ
Hymn.English: 74 To grant us that we, Being delivered from the hand of our enemies, Might serve Him without fear

Hymn.Arabic: 75 بِقَدَاسَةٍ وَبِرّ قُدَّامَهُ جَمِيعَ أَيَّامِ حَيَاتِنَا.
Hymn.English: 75 In holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our life.

Hymn.Arabic: 76 وَأَنْتَ أَيُّهَا الصَّبِيُّ نَبِيَّ الْعَلِيِّ تُدْعَى، لأَنَّكَ تَتَقَدَّمُ أَمَامَ وَجْهِ الرَّبِّ لِتُعِدَّ طُرُقَهُ.
Hymn.English: 76 "And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest; For you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways

Hymn.Arabic: 77 لِتُعْطِيَ شَعْبَهُ مَعْرِفَةَ الْخَلاَصِ بِمَغْفِرَةِ خَطَايَاهُمْ،
Hymn.English: 77 To give knowledge of salvation to His people By the remission of their sins

Hymn.Arabic: 78 بِأَحْشَاءِ رَحْمَةِ إِلهِنَا الَّتِي بِهَا افْتَقَدَنَا الْمُشْرَقُ مِنَ الْعَلاَءِ.
Hymn.English: 78 Through the tender mercy of our God, With which the Dayspring from on high has visited us;

Hymn.Arabic: 79 لِيُضِيءَ عَلَى الْجَالِسِينَ فِي الظُّلْمَةِ وَظِلاَلِ الْمَوْتِ، لِكَيْ يَهْدِيَ أَقْدَامَنَا فِي طَرِيقِ السَّلاَمِ».
Hymn.English: 79 To give light to those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death, To guide our feet into the way of peace."

Hymn.Arabic: 80 أَمَّا الصَّبِيُّ فَكَانَ يَنْمُو وَيَتَقَوَّى بِالرُّوحِ، وَكَانَ فِي الْبَرَارِي إِلَى يَوْمِ ظُهُورِهِ لإِسْرَائِيلَ.
Hymn.English: 80 So the child grew and became strong in spirit, and was in the deserts till the day of his manifestation to Israel.
Praises be to God forever. Amen.
